meanings.definition: In a friendly and pleasant manner.
meanings.sent1: She greeted her guests affably at the door.
meanings.sent2: He always speaks affably to everyone he meets.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed affably as if welcoming us home.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone affably, warming the earth with its gentle rays.
meanings.sent5: The old man smiled affably, his eyes twinkling with kindness.

meanings.definition: Showing warmth and friendliness in conversation.
meanings.sent1: Her affably tone made everyone feel comfortable around her.
meanings.sent2: The affably host made sure everyone had a great time at the party.
meanings.sent3: The affably dog wagged its tail happily at the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The affably atmosphere in the room put everyone at ease.
meanings.sent5: His affably nature made him a favorite among his colleagues.

meanings.definition: Pleasantly easy to approach and talk to.
meanings.sent1: The affably teacher always had time to listen to her students.
meanings.sent2: The affably neighbor was always willing to lend a helping hand.
meanings.sent3: The affably park bench seemed to invite people to sit and relax.
meanings.sent4: The affably smile on her face made strangers feel welcome.
meanings.sent5: The affably shopkeeper greeted customers with a warm hello.
